intro: Berkheya heterophylla, commonly known as the variable Berkheya, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are variable in shape, ranging from linear to broadly lanceolate, which contributes to its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
